intro: Cirsium pubigerum, commonly known as the hairy thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flower heads that resemble thistles. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a robust root system and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Cirsium pubigerum is often found in disturbed areas and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
